nodes.long_description:
ONLY AVAILABLE FOR LICENSED USERS. Sign up for the waitlist to stay updated when Workshop XR is available for you. Visit workshopxr.autodesk.com to learn more and request a free trial.
__ 
Autodesk Workshop XR is an immersive workspace for Autodesk Construction Cloud where AEC teams can review and collaborate in their 3D models to track issues, catch errors, and enable better spatial understanding.

With automatically connected data, no-prep model streaming, and synced issue tracking, Workshop XR makes design reviews frictionless and efficient.

**v1.0**

- Load Revit or Navisworks Models from ACC into VR
- Meet in a collaborative workshop with team members
- Access supported ACC data like Files, Issues, and Model Browser Settings
- Track and create issues

Autodesk Workshop XR is compatible with Meta Quest 2, Meta Quest Pro, and Meta Quest 3.
__ 
FOR LICENSED USERS ONLY 
(Visit workshopxr.autodesk.com to learn more and request a free trial.)
nodes.short_description: Immersive workspace for Autodesk Construction Cloud | Review and collaborate in your 3D models.

nodes.change_log:
# What's New
## Web App
- *View Measurements Created in VR*: Web users are now able to see measurements created in VR while viewing a Workshop on the web app.
- *Create Distance Measurements*: Web users can now use a focused, lightweight tool to create and adjust distance measurements in real-time, with changes syncing across all participants (web and VR).
- *Cross-Platform Gather & Follow*: Web users can now both follow and gather participants during a session, including VR users. VR participants can gather the group but not follow others to avoid motion discomfort. This feature facilitates hosting control for web users.

### Additional Updates:
- VR users can now see what Web App users are pointing at with the laser pointer.
- Improved menu UX and search UI.
- Search by file name.
- File preview.
- Added Settings menu, allowing changes of units and precision, along with other settings.
- Web app users can now remove files from the table to reduce clutter.
- Viewer updates when no model is on the table.
- General improvements to locomotion.
- Disable the right-click menu in the viewer to avoid the context menu appearing.
- Gravity is now disabled by default in 1st person mode in the web app.
- Introduced the HOME button to reset the camera view.
- Web users are now notified when someone mutes them.

## Measure
- *Performance Improvements*: Under-the-hood optimizations to enhance measure snapping stability and performance, particularly when measuring complex geometry, addressing known issues related to performance and flickering snap indicators.
- *UX/UI Improvements*: Added a description to the "Free Measure" setting ("disables snapping") and made minor color changes to snap indicators and perpendicular lines to improve user clarity and better align with ACC mobile.
- *One Click Measure Modes*: Two new distance measure modes designed to reduce clicks and help improve speed and accuracy when taking common distance measurements.
  - Perpendicular – Quickly know the shortest distance between two objects by simply pointing and aiming, with a single button press to then place the measurement as needed.
  - Edge Measure – Quickly know the length of geometry edges by simply pointing and aiming, with a single button press to then place the measurement as needed.

## Model Loading
- *Occlusion Culling*: Workshop XR now intelligently skips rendering geometry hidden behind other objects, only drawing what's visible to the user. This improves performance and efficiency, enhances frame rate and stability in dense scenes, reduces GPU workload, eliminates stutter and lag, and supports scalability for future growth with larger, more detailed models.
- *Grid based BVH*: Partitions the model spatially to assist with culling and reduce tile size by grouping distant objects. This results in higher FPS, especially in model reviews, a more GPU-friendly environment with less unused memory, and more efficient streaming, prefetching, and eviction of tiles, leading to faster performance and cleaner cache management.
- *Background Download / Dual Queue*: Splits the asset pipeline into a Prep queue for preparing assets and a Download queue for fetching assets. This enables faster initial load, smoother streaming, better bandwidth and CPU utilization, and a more efficient user experience with reduced load times and fewer runtime hitches.

# Improvements & More
- Access to Additional Autodesk Docs Region: Workshop XR is now available for users and projects in five additional regions, streamlining access for more customers and projects in the UK, Canada, India, Japan, and Germany.

_Workshop XR is not a regional service. When a customer chooses to use a non-regionalized service like Workshop XR, the output from that service may not be stored regionally. For more information, please visit https://www.autodesk.com/trust/availability_

- Gather Notification: When gathered, users will receive a notification asking if they accept.
- Speaking While Muted Indicator: If a user speaks while muted, they will receive a notification letting them know they are muted.
- Refresh Page: If a Workshop XR page fails to load, the user can now press a refresh button directly on the page.

## Resolved Issues:
- Search bar unresponsive: Fixed an issue where after clicking on the search bar in the Console, the search bar collapses and becomes unresponsive.
- Pairing leading to a blank screen: Fixed an issue where if a signed-out user navigates to https://workshop.autodesk.com/pair, and logs in, then the user is not shown the pairing code. Instead, they are shown a blank screen.
- VR app hangs/crashes after returning from sleep mode: Fixed an issue where Workshop XR would crash/hang when returning from the headset's sleep mode.
- Web app audio settings: Fixed an issue where changes to the mic and speaker settings within the Web App session were not reflected on the PC itself. Updates should now be reflected on both sides.
- Consistency of VR badges: Fixed an issue where VR badges intermittently disappeared when both users were active.
- Missing context menus on the web app: Fixed an issue where, in the People Menu, the user context menu was not displayed.
- Switching model removes web users from the people menu: Fixed an issue where if a VR host would change the model loaded in the workshop, some web app users would disappear from the VR People Menu.
- Teleport POV Fix: On web app, fix POV after teleporting so that the user looks forward instead of on the ground.
- Element Selection Teleport Fix: On web app, disabled element selection by default so that after teleporting, no model geometry should be selected.

### Additional Fixes:
- Fixed an issue where web users could not update the model if the table was empty.
- Disabled unused sub-menu in files panel.
- Fixed filtering of issues by current view.
- Other fixes for VR badge display issues.
- Fixed a bug where the Issues panel would open when a web user follows a VR user and they create an Issue.
- Fixed an issue where users would see a detached laser pointer beam when joining a Workshop.
- Fixed a crash that would sometimes occur when editing new Issues.
- Fixed an issue where the Console would not load when exiting to the home space.
- Fixed an issue where a loading bar would appear in the home space.
- Fixed an issue causing duplicate ACC projects to appear.
- Fixed an issue where some geometry would not appear while the user is turning their head.
- Fixed a crash that would occur when clearing a Workshop model from the web app.
- Fixed an issue where the People menu would not load.
- Fixed an issue where new models would not load once a user shares a 3D view.
- Fixed an issue with camera synchronization when following another user.

- Fixes a crash when editing issue details using voice input
- Fixes a crash when clearing workshop model from web
- Fixes a crash when exiting from 1:1 to Home
- Fixes a crash when Meta avatar fails to load during application launch
- Fixes a crash that occurs when Meta's avatar editor is closed after opened from Home

# What’s New
## Measure
- *Perpendicular Measure Mode*: With the "No Click/One Click" Perpendicular Distance tool, users can quickly find the shortest distance between two surfaces just by pointing and aiming—press select once only when needed. This streamlines measurement workflows, reduces visual clutter, and minimizes the need to delete unnecessary measurements.
- *Crosshair Visual for Snap indicators*: Snap indicators with voids (e.g., square, triangle, circle) now include crosshairs to improve precision when detecting, selecting, and placing endpoints. This update enhances accuracy and includes refinements to sensitivity when placing measurement points at a distance.
- *Edge Measure Mode*: Easily measure the length of geometry edges by simply pointing and aiming with the edge distance tool enabled—click once only when placement is needed. This reduces clicks, improving speed and accuracy for common distance measurements.

## Mute All
- Any participant—VR or Web—can now mute all others with a single action, making it easy to manage background noise, especially with varied web audio setups. This feature improves control, maintains clarity in conversations, and ensures consistent collaboration across different devices.

## Model Loading
- *Dynamic LOD Budgeting*: Automatically balances performance and visual fidelity by displaying distant objects in lower resolution while preserving detailed geometry up close, reducing “box LODs” and optimizing poly budget for smoother navigation in larger, denser projects.
- *Runtime Decimation Control*: Allows users to adjust the model’s decimation level (low, medium, high) on the fly during workshops, enabling real-time control over detail, performance, and focus without needing to reload the model. Higher optimization allows users to opt to prioritize the loading more geometry with the tradeoff that that geometry has been highly decimated, meaning it displays at a lower fidelity.

## Beta Settings
- *(Beta Setting) Hide Measurements*: Allows users to hide all measurements in their current session to reduce visual clutter—only affects the individual who enables it and disables the ability to create new measurements until toggled off.
- *(Beta Setting) 2-sided materials*: An optional setting that renders both sides of faces to fix flipped normals and fill holes caused by mis-oriented geometry—useful for troubleshooting, though off by default due to performance impact.
- *(Beta Setting) Edge Rendering*: Adds outlines to model edges for improved visual clarity, making shapes easier to distinguish and enhancing presentation quality during reviews and screenshots.

## Improvements
- *Optimized Screen Size calculation*: Better screen size calculations for visible objects, contributing to higher visual precision.
- *Click Measurement a second time To Deselect*: Users will be able click measurement a second time to deselect.

# Resolved Issues
- *Pairing issue leading to a blank screen*: Fixed an issue where if a signed-out user navigates to https://workshop.autodesk.com/pair, and logs in, then the user is not shown the pairing code. Instead, they are shown a blank screen.
- *VR app crashes after returning from sleep mode*: Fixed an issue where Workshop XR would crash or freeze after returning from sleep mode, and user would get a notification saying that the app is not responding. The app now reconnects when “waking up” the headset, and this crash will no longer occur.

# Known Issues
- *Issues not displaying and 3D view synchronization problems in VR*: Issues are not visible in user-created views. Issues created in VR are not saved or synchronized. 3D view changes in VR are not reflected on the web interface.
- *Measurements tool does not reset on using other tools*: If measurement panel is open and issue is selected, measurement panel does not collapse and properties button is not visible.
